revisionDesc.change: General - Renamed. Must still be checked carefully against the edition in Aegyptus before finalization.
Add dummy header for original identifier 'papyri.info/ddbdp/p.worp;;22' pointing to new identifier 'papyri.info/ddbdp/aegyptus;96;19'
Line 13: --> Ἀνδρονε̣[ί]κ̣ο(υ). See Sosin's previous submission note.

Vote - AcceptText - I also prefer the suggestion that all expansions, where a second hand is used, should be rendered with subst and the commentary suggested by Sosin should be used. In lin12 I think the the reading (Ἀνδρονε̣[ί]κ̣ο(υ)) is the correct one.

Vote - AcceptText - Accept. We do not currently support attribution of scribal correction, so that we cannot, for example, enter something like <:Θο\ώνιος/=m2|subst|(Θο(ώνιος))=m1:> (lin17) or <:(Ἀνδρονείκ(ου))=m2|subst|(Ἀνδ(ρονείκου))=m1:> (lin13); We can either (1) enter either the add or the del without subst tag at all and indicate what has happened in the Commentary: e.g. enter simply Θο\ώνιος/ and indicate in the Comm that m2 has expanded m1's (Θο(ώνιος)) or (2) enter substs, e.g. <:Θο\ώνιος/|subst|(Θο(ώνιος)):> or <:(Ἀνδρονείκ(ου))|subst|(Ἀνδ(ρονείκου)):> and describe what is happening in the Commentary. Neither is perfect but I incline to the latter. If next voter agrees, then: (a) render all of the m2 expansions with subst and (b) indicate in Commentary something like "In addition to adding material, the second hand has often expanded the first hand's abbreviations, often via supralinear insertion." Even this is a compromise. This text needs revisiting. What is counted as lin12, for example, looks rather like an interlinear insertion (wholesale) by m2; in lin13 has not (Ἀνδρονείκ(ου)) but (Ἀνδρονε̣[ί]κ̣ο(υ)) if not (Ἀνδρον[εί]κ̣ο(υ)) ; traces of the second col are omitted. But all that for another.

Entered Greek text from P.Worp 22. lin5: [Ἀρ] in app [Ἀ]ρ (ρ underdotted], choose app; lin10: put first \τος/ also in $m2 (see ed. note). Note: change of first and second hand, in edition indicated by italicizing, in Leiden+ by repeated $m1, $m2 - even in the abbreviations - seems to me rather 'unquiet'. Perhaps better general note, e.g. " most of the abbreviations have been filled out by a second hand"?
